name: places/ChIJFQqz9ZVZwokRXoT87P66FqM
formattedAddress: 119 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 119 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text:
Just started using them and they ruined a merino wool sweater the 3rd time we cleaned there. A Basic item that should have been easily cared for at a good dry cleaner.  My older daughter’s (12 years old) cardigan is now smaller than the exact same one I have for my 4 year old. Check the pics
Sweater is Italian and over $100 to replace.  Green Apple should make this right and pay for replacement

Sweater is Italian and over $100 to replace.  Green Apple should make this right and pay for replacement

originalText.text:
Ugh, I do not recommend this place.
Completely unhappy w/ the work done here. Sent out a hat and shirt. I asked for the shirt to be dry-cleaned. It looks like it was washed.
Now pilling that wasn’t there before. Hat did not look clean at all. Sent back out to have hat cleaned again and figure out what happened w/ the shirt. The way the hat was hung next to the shirt stained my shirt (inside brim is black suede), so it’s now in much worse shape than before I even dropped it off And they still wanted to charge me.
It also took them 10 days to resend it for a second cleaning. Now the shirt has to be cleaned again. I have a dry cleaner directly across the street from where I live yet decided to walk 10min out of my way to use the “green” cleaners.

originalText.text: Sadly, I will no longer be able to use or recommend Green Apple Cleaners. I used them for dry cleaning for over a year and was very happy with the service I received. However, in December they significantly damaged and ruined a very expensive sweater. I spoke with Kathy at the Greenwich Ave location who was very kind and helpful, and eventually passed along my information so I could be reimbursed. But no one ever contacted me. Many attempts via email and phone calls over weeks and weeks, and neither the manager or owner returned any of my communications or contacted me. I simply cannot return to a business that ignores customers and makes no effort to reimburse them for damages. I haven't even been reimbursed for what I paid to have the item dry cleaned.

originalText.text: Highly recommend. Absolutely fantastic dry cleaning service company, from the seamless pickup scheduling to the quality of environmentally-friendly cleaning, to the level of care and communication. So thrilled I found an eco-responsible dry cleaner that cares!

text.text: Highly recommend. Absolutely fantastic dry cleaning service company, from the seamless pickup scheduling to the quality of environmentally-friendly cleaning, to the level of care and communication. So thrilled I found an eco-responsible dry cleaner that cares!

originalText.text: We asked for pick up and delivery of “our regular wash and dry”- NOT ANY DRY CLEANING! Green Apple delicately and lovingly Dry Cleaned all our wash load including our unmentionables & hung up each item on its own hanger! Lucky for us it was our first load- so we paid $84.00 instead Of $168.00- and we got a 50% discount! We lost our red satin laundry bag in the process! I will miss the red bag as all other New Yorkers have Black laundry bags! I refuse to get a black laundry bag to replace our old red one!!
